title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 02
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: By climbing up the rocks close to the stream, the distance tothe loch is considerably shortened; and Philips, who had often clamberedto the top of the Bitch Craig, a high cliff on the Manor Water, proposedto his brother that they should "speel the height."

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 02
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: By climbing up the rocks close to the stream, the distance tothe loch is considerably shortened; and Philips, who had often clamberedto the top of the Bitch Craig, a high cliff on the Manor Water, proposedto his brother that they should "speel the height."

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: But in one of his night-rides hisgood fortune failed him; for being after no good on the hills aboveMegget one dark wintry night, he fell over the Bitch Craig, horse andall; and though he escaped with his life, he was lamed in both legs andcondemned to the house for the rest of his days.
